item.title: Indexing in Python
item.description: Indexing is when you grab certain elements from a vector or list. It’s done a little differently in Python compared to R. First, let’s take a look at how indexing is done in R. I’ve made a list of my favorite fruits. I did this in reticulate so that I can access the same list in Python. Now, I’ll grab the second through fourth elements in the list in R: fruits <- c("mango","apricot","nectarine","dragonfruit","kiwi","fig","raspberry","lychee","loquat","jackfruit") fruits[2:4] ## [1] "apricot" "nectarine" "dragonfruit" In R, the first element is at position 1, so positions 2 through 4 correspond to elements 2 through 4.
